divs: sighting detailsin the last two days i have witnessed 3 different unidentified objects. while i am not sure if they are ufo per se, i am reporting them as odd objects and unknown to me. last night about 8:30 p.m. exiting off 496 going west to waverly road exit, preparing to turn right onto waverly north, i looked out my driver window to the south, and above the overpass witnessed what appeared to be a light streak coming down from the sky from an easterly direction to a west direction and then make an abrupt stop and what then appeared to begin flashing. it happened very quickly and i wasn't even sure what i saw, but i first thought maybe it was a falling star, but it it seem to not burn out but stop abruptly. today 12\13\12 at about 9:00 a.m., i was headed to work and, as an avid sky watcher, and conspiracy theorist, i was noticing all the chem trails in the sky this morning over lansing. as i was driving south, i looked up and saw a bright reflection, which was quite aways away from where i was, i continued to watch it while i was driving and noticed that it was much lower than the jets flying above it in the sky. it seemed oval\round from my perspective and was not very big, but then seemed to just disappear and the reflection was gone. this evening about 6:45 p.m. i was looking out my dining room window, which faces south, at the night sky and noticed what appeared to be a helicoper just sort of hovering south\west of my home flashing red and white lights. i continued to watch it, and then further from the west, i noticed a small, orangish colored light flying in my direction, which would have been from the south\west to a northeast direction, it flew over my home at about 500 ft above, and did not have any flashing lights just continued to be bright orangish colored and continued on at a normal-somewhat quick pace. as it went past my home, i continued to watch it and it seemd to have dimmed and no longer emminating light from my perspective. it did not make any noise either. i wondered if the "helicoptor" noticed it or was even guiding it in? it seemed odd and somewhat out of place.
